get.description: Getting a list of addresses

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Number of page that should be returned

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of items that should be shown on a page (default value is 100)

allOf.description: An address that was created. It is referenced by its id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of a previously created address

get.description: Returns a single address based on its identifier

200.description: Detailed information about a single address

get.description: Returns all carriers for the user associated with the api key

allOf.description: key for referencing the carrier within shipcloud

display_name.description: name of the carrier you can use to display it in your application

items.description: key for referencing the service within shipcloud
key for referencing the package type within shipcloud
key to identify the additional service

get.description: Getting the default returns address

200.description: Detailed information the default returns address

200.description: A manifest has been successfully created!

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier of a previously created manifest

get.description: Getting information about a manifest

200.description: Detailed information about a single manifest

get.description: Getting information about the current user

get.description: Getting a list of previously created orders

parameters.name: external_order_id
parameters.description: Filter orders by their external order id

parameters.name: external_customer_id
parameters.description: Filter orders by their external customer id

parameters.name: created_at_gt
parameters.description: Get orders with a `created_at` date that is bigger then the one provided

parameters.name: created_at_lt
parameters.description: Get orders with a `created_at` date that is smaller then the one provided

get.description: Getting a previously created order.
Search pickup dropoff locations by address or geographical coordinates.

200.description: A successful response with a list of pickup dropoff locations.

parameters.name: carriers
parameters.description: Must be set with the carrier names (see /carriers endpoint). Multiple carriers can be given as a comma separated list.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: The street with house number and addition if applicable of the address.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state, county or province of the address.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: The geographical coordinate that specifies the north-south position.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: The geographical coordinate that specifies the east-west position.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of locations to include in the search result.

get.description: Get all pickup requests for this user

post.description: Create a pickup request with a carrier, so they come and get the parcels

allOf.description: Pickup request for a one time pickup

carrier.description: acronym of the carrier you want to use

id.description: The identifier of the shipment that should be picked up

get.description: Returns a single pickup request based on the id

200.description: Detailed information about a single pickup request

post.description: Find out how much we will charge you for a specific shipment when using shipcloud carrier contracts.

id.description: id of a receivers address
id of a senders address

200.description: Shipment quote for a single shipment

price.description: Price that shipcloud is going to charge you (exl. VAT)

get.description: Returns a list of shipments

tracking_events.details: Die Sendung wurde in das Zustellfahrzeug geladen.
Die Sendung wurde im Start-Paketzentrum bearbeitet.
Die Sendung wurde im Start-Paketzentrum bearbeitet.
Die Sendung wurde im Start-Paketzentrum bearbeitet.

get.description: Returns a single shipment based on the id

200.description: Detailed information about a single shipment

put.description: Updates a single shipment based on the id. Unfortunately you can't update the `customs_declaration` attribute at the moment.

200.description: Updated information about a single shipment

delete.description: Deletes a single shipment. **Notice:**  Prepared shipments (where `create_shipping_label` is `false`) can be deleted at any time, because no transaction with the carrier has happened until this point and no actual shipping label has been created. In case you've created a shipping label you can delete it before the cutoff time of the carrier. Cutoff times differ from carrier to carrier and are some time between 5pm and 8pm.

get.description: Returns a list of shipment documents for a single shipment based on the id (available as of mid-March 2025)

post.description: Create a shipment document (available as of mid-March 2025)

get.description: Returns a single shipment document based on the id (available as of mid-March 2025)

200.description: Detailed information about a single shipment document

get.description: Get a list of previously created trackers

schema.description: Trackers allow you to monitor a shipment even though it wasn't created using shipcloud

carrier_tracking_no.description: Tracking number (provided by the carrier) of the shipment which should be monitored

allOf.description: acronym of the carrier the shipment was created with

id.description: id of a receivers address
id of a senders address

notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment. Usually the recipients'

get.description: Get a single tracker

200.description: Returns information about a single tracker based on its identifier.

get.description: Get a list of previously created webhooks

post.description: Creating a webhook on the shipcloud platform

get.description: Returns a single webhook based on the provided id

200.description: Detailed information about a single webhook

delete.description: Deletes a single webhook identified by its id

tracking_events.details: Lieferung hat das Logistikzentrum verlassen und ist unterwegs.
Ihre Sendung wurde zugestellt. Die Sendung wurde zugestellt an Simon Fröhler shipcloud GmbH.

country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

state.description: The state the address is in

street.description: Name of the street. Can hold the house number

street_no.description: House number of the address (when a carrier requires it separately)

phone.description: Telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is `one_day` or `one_day_early` or ship to country is different than ship from country)

email.description: Email address for this person. Some carrier are using the email address to send notifications

id.description: identifier of a previously created address
identifier of a previously created address

country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

state.description: The state the address is in

street.description: Name of the street. Can hold the house number

street_no.description: House number of the address (when a carrier requires it separately)

phone.description: Telephone number (mandatory when using UPS and the following terms apply: service is `one_day` or `one_day_early` or ship to country is different than ship from country)

email.description: Email address for this person. Some carrier are using the email address to send notifications

current_user.description: Getting information about the user that is making the request

id.description: The unique identifier for this user (generated by shipcloud).

email.description: The email address associated with this user

customer_no.description: The unique identifier for this customer (generated by shipcloud). Used e.g. in support cases.

environment.description: Shows the corresponding environment for the currently used api key.

plan_name.description: A key to identify the plan the user currently has

plan_display_name.description: Name of the plan the user currently has. Can be used for displaying it at the frontend.

chargeable.description: true if the user has provided a chargeable payment method.

contents_explanation.description: description of contents. Mandatory if contents_type is `commercial_goods`. Max 256 characters, when using DHL as your carrier

additional_fees.description: additional custom fees to be payed

drop_off_location.description: location where the package will be dropped of with the carrier

total_value_amount.description: the overall value of the shipments' contents

origin_country.description: Country as uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code

hs_tariff_number.description: customs tariff number. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harmonized_System#Tariffs_by_region for detailed information on region specific tariff numbers

quantity.description: Number that defines how many items of this kind are in the shipment

value_amount.description: The total value for items of this kind

net_weight.description: Total net weight for a single item of this kind

gross_weight.description: Total gross weight for a single item of this kind

created_at.description: timestamp of when the customs declaration was created

updated_at.description: timestamp of when the customs declaration was last updated

carrier_declaration_document_url.description: A URL that points to the customs declaration document

id.description: A unique identifier for this item

created_at.description: timestamp of when the item was created

updated_at.description: timestamp of when the item was last updated

format.description: defines the format that the returned label should have

size.description: defines the size that the returned label should have

fallback.description: Dynamic object to contain text in different languages. The `fallback` key has to be specified, and its value must not be empty. All other keys are optional, but if given, they should be valid lowercase `ISO-639-1` codes.

carrier.description: Carrier for whom the maifest should be created

allOf.description: Address of the hub where the shipments will be overturned to the carrier

shipments.description: array of shipment IDs that are send using this manifest

reference_number.description: For referencing the manifest at the carrier

carrier_reference_number.description: Reference used by the carrier to identify the manifest

created_at.description: timestamp of when the manifest was created

document_url.description: URL where you can download the manifest in pdf format

identifier.description: An identifier that specifies the type of the document being returned

id.description: identifier of a previously created manifest

placed_at.description: Date that shows When the order has been placed

external_order_id.description: An external identifier for this order

external_customer_id.description: An external identifier for the customer who has placed the order

total_price.description: The total amount of the order

total_vat.description: The total VAT of the order

currency.description: Currency that the customer uses for paying the order

refundable_until.description: Used to disable returns for the whole order after a specific time (a Return Portal Plus feature).

refund_deduction_amount.description: Part of the order's return costs the customer has to pay (a Return Portal Plus feature).

weight_unit.description: The unit associated with the weight. Mandatory when `total_weight` is given

order_line_items.description: Array of objects containing the items that have been bought with this order

quantity.description: Quantity of this item in the order

price.description: Price the customer has to pay for a single item

vat.description: VAT one has to pay for a single item

currency.description: Currency the item has to be payed in

weight.description: How much a single item is weighing

weight_unit.description: Unit used for the weight measurement

external_order_line_item_id.description: An external identifier for this order line item

item_info.description: Information about this variant version of the product. Used to display a (localized) label and value pair to describe an item's property, e.g. a product category.

gross_price.description: Gross price in Euro of an item. Used to calculate the refund amount of a return shipment (a Return Portal Plus feature).

returnable.description: Indicates if an order line item can be returned (a Return Portal Plus feature).

returnable_until.description: Used to disable returns for an order line item after a specific time.

id.description: identifier of a previously created order line item
identifier of a previously created order

declared_value.description: Object that is used for booking an additional insurance at the carrier (if applicable)

amount.description: The total amount of the goods value that an additional insurance should be booked for

currency.description: The currency used. Currently only EUR is applicable

description.description: if you're using UPS with service `returns` this is mandatory otherwise it's optional

type.description: type of shipment you would like to book

declared_value.description: Object that is used for booking an additional insurance at the carrier (if applicable)

amount.description: The total amount of the goods value that an additional insurance should be booked for

currency.description: The currency used. Currently only EUR is applicable

description.description: if you're using UPS with service `returns` this is mandatory otherwise it's optional

type.description: type of shipment you would like to book

height.description: Height of the parcel in cm

length.description: Length of the parcel in cm

weight.description: Weight of the parcel in kg

width.description: Width of the parcel in cm

id.description: A unique identifier for this package

timestamp.description: timestamp of when this event occured

location.description: location of the package at this moment

status.description: A key that is describing the status

details.description: Message the carrier sent to describe the package status

pickup.description: for some carriers a pickup has to be requested when creating a shipment

pickup_time_object.description: defines a time window in which the carrier should pickup shipments

id.description: shipcloud identifier for this pickup request

allOf.description: carrier used for this pickup request

carrier_pickup_number.description: Identifier that the carrier uses for this pickup request

id.description: id of the shipment included in this pickup request

service.description: The service that should be used for the shipment.

allOf.description: If missing, the default sender address (if defined in your shipcloud account) will be used
Overwrites the sender address on the shipping label

reference_number.description: a reference number (max. 30 characters) that you want this shipment to be identified with. You can use this afterwards to easier find the shipment in the shipcloud.io backoffice

description.description: text that describes the contents of the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS and the following conditions are true: from and to countries are not the same; from and/or to countries are not in the EU; from and to countries are in the EU and the shipments service is not `standard`. The parameter is also mandatory when using DHL Express as carrier.

notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment (usually the recipients')

transportation.description: Determines, who will pay for transportation. This is applicable for domestic and international shipments

type.description: Providing the key that will determine, who will pay for transportation

account_number.description: The account number that will be billed

zip_code.description: The zip code / postalcode associated with the provided account number

country.description: The country code associated with the provided account number

duties_and_taxes.description: Determines, who will pay for duties and taxes. This is only applicable for international shipments

type.description: Providing the key that will determine, who will pay for duties and taxes

account_number.description: The account number that will be billed

zip_code.description: The zip code / postalcode associated with the provided account number

country.description: The country code associated with the provided account number

name.description: key to identify the additional service

bank_account_holder.description: Name of the person the bank account belongs to (cash_on_delivery)

id_type.description: Type of ID document that should be used for verifying (hermes_ident_check)

language.description: Language (in ISO-639-1 format) the customer should be notified in (advanced_notice)

minimum_age.description: Minimum age that should be checked (dhl_ident_check, visual_age_check)

phone.description: Phone number that can be called for making the delivery (advanced_notice)

reference1.description: Text that should be displayed as the reason for transfer (cash_on_delivery)

sms.description: Phone number that can be texted for making the delivery (advanced_notice)

order_id.description: Identifier of a previously created order.

returned_items.description: List of items that get returned with this shipment

order_line_item_id.description: UUID of the corresponding order line item within an order

quantity.description: Number that defines how many items of this kind are in the shipment

reason_for_return.description: A key that represents the reason why the item(s) will be returned

create_shipping_label.description: determines if a shipping label should be created at the carrier (this means you will be charged when using the production api key)

metadata.description: here you can save additional data that you want to be associated with the shipment. Any combination of key-value pairs is possible

allOf.description: If missing, the default sender address (if defined in your shipcloud account) will be used
Overwrites the sender address on the shipping label

reference_number.description: a reference number (max. 30 characters) that you want this shipment to be identified with. You can use this afterwards to easier find the shipment in the shipcloud.io backoffice

description.description: text that describes the contents of the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if you're using UPS and the following conditions are true: from and to countries are not the same; from and/or to countries are not in the EU; from and to countries are in the EU and the shipments service is not `standard`. The parameter is also mandatory when using DHL Express as carrier.

notification_email.description: email address that we should notify once there's an update for this shipment (usually the recipients')

create_shipping_label.description: determines if a shipping label should be created at the carrier (this means you will be charged when using the production api key)

metadata.description: here you can save additional data that you want to be associated with the shipment. Any combination of key-value pairs is possible

id.description: identifier of the shipment

carrier_tracking_no.description: the original tracking number that can be used on the carriers website

carrier_tracking_url.description: the original tracking URL of the carrier

label_url.description: URL where you can download the label in pdf format

price.description: price that we're going to charge you (exl. VAT)

shipper_notification_email.description: email address of the shipper who should be notified of a change of shipment status by shipcloud

tracking_url.description: URL you can send your customers so they can track this shipment

content.description: base64 encoded content of the document

id.description: id of the document

document_url.description: URL where you can download the document in pdf format

carrier_tracking_no.description: tracking number (provided by the carrier) for this shipment

id.description: id of a senders address

tracking_status_updated_at.description: timestamp the tracking status was last updated

last_polling_at.description: timestamp the shipment status was last polled at the carrier

next_polling_at.description: timestamp the shipment status will be polled the next time

shipment_id.description: id of the corresponding shipment within shipcloud

allOf.description: acronym of the carrier the shipment was sent with

id.description: id of a receivers address

timestamp.description: timestamp of when this event occured

location.description: location of the package at this moment

details.description: message the carrier sends to describe the shipments status

id.description: the tracker id that can be used for requesting info about a tracker

webhook_event_types.description: the event types that a webhook can have

webhook_object.description: Webhooks inform your system of events that have happened within the shipcloud platform

url.description: The URL that the webhook should call

event_types.description: Events this webhook should subscribe to

security.description: Security object to hold data for securing the webhook

username.description: The username that should be used (for basic auth)

password.description: The password that should be used (for basic auth)

id.description: the webhook id that can be used for requesting info about a webhook

deactivated.description: set to true, if the call of the webhook URL fails ten times.

distance.description: Distance in the unit of measure defined in distance_unit_of_measure

day.description: Days are numbered from 1 to 7 (Monday to Sunday).

pickup_dropoff_location.description: A single location of a carrier. Includes opening hours, additional properties and (optional) maximum package measurements.
pickup_dropoff_location.title: pickup_dropoff_location

RateLimit-Limit.description: A number that shows the overall limit of requests this user can send (e.g. 120)

RateLimit-Interval.description: The number of seconds the interval for this user is long (e.g. 60)

RateLimit-Remaining.description: Remaining number of request in the current interval (e.g. 111)

RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds that shows when the request rate limit resets (e.g. 42)

shicloud-Request-ID.description: An internal identifier that we generate for every request. If you encounter a problem with your request, please send us this id when opening a support case.

400.description: Your request was not correct. Please see the response body for more detailed information.

items.description: Strings that describe, what has gone wrong. We're tunnelling error responses from the carriers. When this is the case, we try to prefix an error with 'The carrier {xyz} returned the following error:'

401.description: Something has gone wrong when authorizing with our API. Please check e.g. if you're trying to use your sandbox api key with an operation that can only be used with a live API key.

402.description: You've reached a maximum that is defined in your current plan. Please upgrade to a higher plan.

403.description: You are not allowed to talk to this endpoint. This can either be due to a wrong authentication or when you're trying to reach an endpoint that your account isn't allowed to access.

404.description: The api endpoint or ressource you were trying to reach can't be found.

422.description: Your request was well-formed but couldn't be followed due to semantic errors. Please see the response body for more detailed information. A possible problem could be that you are not sending all the data that is required or data that is not necessary for this call.

500.description: Something has seriously gone wrong. Don't worry, we'll have a look at it. If the error persists, please don't hesitate to contact us by sending us an email containing the `X-Request-ID` header we've returned.

502.description: Something has gone wrong while talking to an external backend (e.g. a carriers' webservice). Please see the response body for more detailed information.

504.description: Unfortunately we couldn't connect to the carrier backend. It is either very slow or not reachable at all. If you want to stay informed about the carrier status, have a look at [our statuspage](https://status.shipcloud.io)

externalDocs.description: Find more info at the shipcloud developer portal
